Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I just submitted PGT to be listed on Coinpaprika including links to white paper, linkedin of team members, block explorers, API endpoints for circulating supply, coin icon (from BarterDEX github).

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I'm not sure if PGT is on other exchanges yet besides BarterDEX/HyperDEX but the information for them there is incomplete. So Idk how they will list it with markets/price without that information. I'll see if I can update that stuff as well.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: But it might be only possible to list if PGT is on an exchange with price information.

Content: do you have electrum servers?

Content: let me check

Content: ok just sent PR @jorian

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: https://github.com/jl777/coins/pull/229

Content: you might want to change the port

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: does it cause issues?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: not sure why we set this one, its just the one we are using right now but if it needs to be changed for a good reason can be changed

Author: jorian#4555
Content: KMD uses that one

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: so it creates some kind of incompatibility?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: yes wait a moment I think thats not correctly set

Author: jorian#4555
Content: yes

Author: jorian#4555
Content: if i use KMD as electrum i cant use PGT anymore

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: ok so only when setting up all electrum servers together?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: guess from a mobile client doesnt care where remote electrum has the port set right?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: I mean, I understand we cannot set 2 electrum servers on port 10001 because only one would work

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: but from a light wallet point of view, I guess it shouldnt care calling Server A for coin A on port 10001 and Server B for Coin B on port 10001

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: btw I think I missed the port and checking with devops because seems port its 10002 üòÉ

Author: jorian#4555
Content: it's your mobile application using that port

Author: jorian#4555
Content: hmm. i don't remember actually

Author: jorian#4555
Content: but there is a reason

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: I just sent PR with updated ports

Author: jorian#4555
Content: @cipi knows

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
as long as the hostname is another one, it does not matter, you can use same port
on the server it does matter, you can't tell 2 daemons to use the same port

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
explorer link is this PR is wrong, i guess: https://github.com/jl777/coins/pull/229/files
GUI add txid to the link from explorers/PGT and expects to get the transaction
should be something like `["https://explorer.pungotoken.com/tx/"]`
